content.description: Climb easy jugs to a first bolt to crimps with a tree assist. Double dyno to the last handhold. There is a nice arete to clip the anchor.
content.protection: 1 bolt to a 2 bolt anchor. The anchor is far apart, so bring slings if setting up a toprope. There are no rap rings. A downclimb is necessary after cleaning.
content.location: It is located on the north side of the university on east face of HQ.

content.description: Chossy and Chunky is an absolutely crisp route. There are nice holds all the way up with some bomber rocks at the top. The whole route is conveniently marked with black spray paint dots. As far as urban, private-property chimney ascents go, this is an absolute classic.
content.protection: A crashpad is certainly recommended if you don't plan on topping out on the roof. If you don't have one, you should be able to find one on the south side of the house next to the fence.
content.location: The route is located midway through the west-facing wall of the house on the southeast corner of 10th St. and Aurora Ave. Approach through the rocks on from either Aurora or 10th through the rocky yard to the crag.
